description: Astronauts Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams were originally sent up to the International Space Station for what was supposed to be an 8-day mission. That plan has stretched into two months after their vehicle, the Boeing Starliner, experienced thruster and other issues that have not been fully resolved. Now, NASA says it's considering a plan to bring them back in a SpaceX capsule instead. SSP for ATC 8/8. Already spotted. No digital planned. Reporter: Brendan Byrne. Editor: Amina Khan.
title: After two months, astronauts stranded at the ISS may have a way back home

description: At the Paris Olympics Thursday evening, the United States has a real possibility of winning several gold medals at track and field events.
title: Here's what happened at the Olympic track and field events tonight

description: For over a week race riots have broken out in the United Kingdom, mostly in smaller, poorer, less diverse cities. The violence has been stoked by misinformation and disinformation online. Our reporter travels to one of the places that saw mob violence to understand why it's happening.
title: The Root Cause of the Race Riots in the UK
How Lahaina wildfire survivors are marking one year from the tragedy

description: NPR's Ailsa Chang talks with Dr. Aileen Gariepy of Weill Cornell Medicine about the new federal guidance that advises doctors to consider pain management for IUD insertion pain.
title: New CDC guidance recommends doctors address IUD insertion pain for patients

description: Some 15 million people are expected to attend the Olympic games in Paris, which are now in their second week. Keeping them safe is a top priority, so the French government has brought in soldiers.
title: Thousands of French soldiers are in Paris to help secure the Olympics

description: As Harris has risen up in the political world, the name Kamala is getting more air time. And on the campaign trail, Harris’ name has been mispronounced intentionally by her opponent.
title: The significance of Trump's repeated mispronunciation of 'Kamala'

description: For nearly all of Thursday's semifinal game against Serbia, the U.S. lagged behind Serbia. Even as the fourth quarter began, the U.S. trailed by 13. But then Team USA turned it around to win 95-91.
title: The U.S. men's basketball team wins a nail-biter over Serbia to play for Olympic gold

description: The athlete, identified as Luzar Dukic, was taking part in the individual swim portion of the annul fitness competition where athletes compete for the title of "Fittest on Earth."
title: 1 dead after swimming during CrossFit Games competition in Fort Worth

description: Powering your home with rooftop solar panels is great for the planet but isn't always a good deal for consumers. One of the problems might be with the way the industry was built in the first place.
title: Hundreds of thousands of solar panel customers may be paying more than they should

description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with Christopher Schuetze, a reporter with the New York Times who’s been covering a foiled terrorist attack at a Taylor Swift concert in Vienna.
title: New details emerge on foiled Vienna attack

description: Republican JD Vance and Democrat Tim Walz are both vets, but Vance has taken digs at Walz's service, accusing the Minnesota governor of one of the most grievous charges possible in military circles.
title: Vance accused Walz of 'stolen valor.' What to know about Walz’s military record

description: The National Transportation Safety Board held a two-day hearing on the January "door plug" blowout aboard a Boeing 737 Max 9 plane flown by Alaska Airlines.
title: NTSB wraps up 'door plug' hearing as new Boeing CEO takes over

description: The special public unveiling of “Panda Ridge” was scheduled for noon on Thursday. They’re the first pandas to come to the United States in 21 years.
title: The panda-drought ends in California as San Diego Zoo's new arrivals welcome visitors

description: Mortgage rates fell to 6.47% this week, prompting a flurry of refinancing activity.  Rates are still much higher than they were a few years ago, however, leaving many homeowners reluctant to move.
title: Housing relief? Mortgage rates drop to their lowest level in over a year

description: The clear favorite, Noah Lyles came in third for bronze behind his American teammate Kenneth Bednarek.
title: No Olympic sprint double for American Noah Lyles; Botswana's Letsile Tebogo wins 200m

description: The multi-million dollar figure adds to Harris' record-shattering fundraising haul.
title: Harris campaign raises $36 million in 24 hours after announcing Walz as running mate

description: Joshua Cheptegei, who grew up in rural Uganda, is the record holder in the 10,000-meter race and an Olympic champion. Here's what we should do for all youngsters to help them fulfill their dreams.
title: Uganda's gold medal runner wants all kids to 'make it.' But they need help

description: Gwen and Tim Walz met while teaching high school in the '90s, and she's now a vocal advocate for expanding educational opportunities in prisons. Here's what else to know about Minnesota's first lady.
title: What to know about Minnesota First Lady Gwen Walz

description: Some children who had COVID developed a severe inflammatory response that coult put them in the ICU. Scientists have learned why it happens.
title: Researchers decipher MIS-C, the scary illness that followed COVID in some kids

description: After setting a couple world speed climbing records this week, American Sam Watson fell to China’s Peng Wu, who was then beaten by Indonesia’s Leonardo Veddriq. Veddriq took gold in 4.75 seconds.
title: Technically, the fastest Olympian just took bronze in speed climbing

description: Usha Vance grew up in San Diego and clerked for Supreme Court Chief Justice John Roberts after Yale Law School. Here's what else to know about the wife of the Republican vice presidential candidate.
title: What to know about Usha Vance, JD Vance's wife

description: Climate change advocates heaped praise on Minnesota Governor Tim Walz
title: Here’s what Tim Walz did on climate change as Minnesota governor

description: Today, Maui residents remember the 102 people who lost their lives one year ago in a massive wildfire. Plus, Harris and Tim Walz continue on their introductory tour as JD Vance shadows them closely.
title: Making Hawaii safer, 1 year after the fire. And, Dems embrace 'Tampon Tim'

description: As Ukraine receives new weapons -- such as F-16 fighter jets -- Ukrainian troops struggle to halt a Russian ground offensive in the eastern part of the country.
title: Ukraine must drive Russia troops away from border areas, a Zelenskyy adviser says

description: NPR's Leila Fadel talks to Democratic strategist David Axelrod about the energy behind Kamala Harris' campaign, and how Democrats can capitalize on the momentum.
title: Democrats' presidential campaign seems to have renewed energy after Harris' VP pick

description: As Olympic athletes break records in track & field this week, they're also busting myths about body size and running. This generation of female runners are fueling up for strength and stamina.
title: A new generation of elite female runners embrace strength over thinness

description: Ukrainian soldiers appear to be several miles inside Russia’s Kursk region, where they are in several villages. Russia’s top military official says some 1,000 Ukrainian troops are taking part.
title: In a surprise attack, Ukraine sends a large force into western Russia

description: The National Transportation Safety Board has wrapped up a two-day hearing on the January "door plug" blowout aboard a Boeing 737 Max 9 plane flown by Alaska Airlines.
title: NTSB wraps up 'door plug' hearing. What did the safety board learn?

description: After 102 people died in wildfires one year ago, Maui’s officials have committed to creating new evacuation routes. But even though the buildings are gone, remaking the map is a harder task.
title: After 1 year, remembering the deadly Maui wildfire

description: NPR's Leila Fadel asks counterterrorism expert Javed Ali about the cancellation of Taylor Swift concerts in Austria after officials uncovered an apparent plot to attack large events.
title: Organizers cancel Taylor Swift concerts in Vienna over fears of an attack

description: For the second year in a row, an outburst of flooding from a naturally dammed lake at the Mendenhall Glacier has caused damage to homes in Juneau.
title: Alaskans recount escapes after a record-breaking glacial outburst flood hits Juneau

description: Some of the first protestors on the streets of Ferguson, Missouri, after Michael Brown was killed ten years ago have become national figures. NPR's Michel Martin talks to DeRay Mckesson.
title: 10 years after Michael Brown was killed in Ferguson, what’s changed with protests?

description: Vice President Harris is campaigning with running mate Tim Walz, and massive crowds have been turning out to see them. They’ll be in Phoenix Thursday night and then head toward Las Vegas.
title: Harris and Walz continue their introductory tour of the Democratic ticket
